snippet: Army Corps of Engineers and Coast Guard officials said efforts to keep a crucial stretch of the drought-starved Mississippi River open to barge traffic should avert a shipping shutdown.
abstract: Army Corps of Engineers and Coast Guard officials say efforts to keep crucial stretch of  drought-starved Mississippi River open to barge traffic should be sufficient enough to avert a shipping shutdown.
lead_paragraph: Army Corps of Engineers and Coast Guard officials said efforts to keep a crucial stretch of the drought-starved Mississippi River open to barge traffic should avert a shipping shutdown.

headline.main: Missouri: Army Corps Is Optimistic on River’s Depth
headline.print_headline: Missouri: Army Corps Is Optimistic On River’s Depth
